text:
Markers are not displayed in the middle of a Bezier curve.  See the test case 
below.  I'm not familiar with the Batik source code but I could tale a look at 
this if someone can give me an idea where in the sources to look.


<?xml version="1.0" standalone="no"?>

<!DOCTYPE svg PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD SVG 20001102//EN" 
  "http://www.w3.org/TR/2000/CR-SVG-20001102/DTD/svg-20001102.dtd">

<svg width="4in" height="2in" 
     viewBox="0 0 4000 2000" >
  <defs>
    <marker id="Triangle"
      viewBox="0 0 10 10" refX="0" refY="5" 
      markerUnits="strokeWidth"
      markerWidth="4" markerHeight="3"
      orient="auto">
      <path d="M 0 0 L 10 5 L 0 10 z" />
    </marker>
  </defs>
  <rect x="10" y="10" width="3980" height="1980"
       style="fill:none; stroke:blue; stroke-width:10"/>
  <desc>Placing an arrowhead at the end of a path.
  </desc>
  <path d="M 1000 750 L 2000 750 L 2500 1250"
	fill="none"
	stroke="black"
	stroke-width="100"
	marker-end="url(#Triangle)"/>
  <path d="M 1000 750 C 1500 750  1500 250 1000 250"
	fill="none"
	stroke="blue"
	stroke-width="100"
	marker-end="url(#Triangle)"
   />

  <!-- marker-mid doesn't work for Bezier paths -->
  <path d="M 1000 750 C 1500 750  1500 1250 1000 1250"
	fill="none"
	stroke="red"
	stroke-width="100"
	marker-mid="url(#Triangle)"
   />
</svg>

This is not a bug. Bezier curves does not have a middle point (only a start,
control and end point) so only marker-start and marker-end work.
